Description: Fragment of lower wall of Attic black-figured large pottery open vase. Glazed inside save for reserved area at top edged with dilute glaze; outside, flexed right leg and lower part of raised left leg of man (dancing?) facing left.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The reserved band inside seems low on the vase for a krater. Heidelberg, Antikenmuseum I52-I77 and I85-I92 have in the past been erroneously known and cited as J52-77 and J85-92.
Bibliographic references: CVA Heidelberg IV / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Deutschland Heidelberg, Universität (p.51 pl. 166.7)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1054)
